clinical_study.brief_title: XLIMus Drug Eluting Stent: a randomIzed Controlled Trial to Assess Endothelization
clinical_study.official_title: XLIMus Drug Eluting Stent: a randomIzed Controlled Trial to Assess Endothelization

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to assess angiographic and clinical performance of Xlimus Drug Eluting Stent (DES) compared to Synergy Bioabsorbable Polymer Everolimus Eluting Stent in patients treated with percutaneous coronary angioplasty

detailed_description.textblock: The present clinical investigation is designed as a prospective, multicentre, international, randomized, open label, 2-arm parallel group, trial in patients undergoing Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) comparing Xlimus DES versus Synergy DES with respect to optical coherence tomography (OCT) derived measures at 6-month Follow Up (FU) and clinical events at 12 months after procedure. A total of 180 patients will be recruited and randomized in the two groups in a 2:1 ratio. After index procedure, patients will be followed up by angiographic follow-up at 6 months and clinical follow-up at 12 months.The primary endpoint will be independently evaluated by the Core-Lab which will be blinded as to group assignment

study_design_info.masking_description: The members of the Event Adjudication Committee and the Core Lab will be blinded to the patient assignment.

primary_outcome.description: In-stent neointimal volume at 6-month follow-up, measured with OCT, as assessed by the Core-Lab. Neointimal volume will be calculated in all analyzed cross-sections and volumetric measurements and in stent neointimal volume will be compared in the two groups.

secondary_outcome.description: Neointimal area calculated at the site of minimal lumen area measured with OCT
composite of Cardiac death, target-vessel Myocardial infarction (MI) and clinically indicated target lesion revascularization (TLR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients experiencig Cardiac death
secondary_outcome.description: Any death due to proximate cardiac cause (eg, MI, fatal arrhythmia), unwitnessed death and death of unknown cause, and all procedure-related deaths, including those related to concomitant treatment, will be classified as cardiac death

any MI that, irrespective of the time after the index procedure, is related to documented acute ischemia in the territory of the implanted stent without angiographic confirmation of stent thrombosis and in the absence of any other obvious cause. Type of acute MI is classified according to the Joint ESC/ACCF/AHA/ WHF Joint Task Force for the Universal Definition of Myocardial Infarction
repeat revascularization will be defined as any repeat PCI or new coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery within the first year post-PCI
This is defined according to classification proposed by the Academic Research Consortium

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Device success at 24 hours
secondary_outcome.description: deployment of the assigned stents without system failure or device-related complication

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Lesion success at 24 hours
secondary_outcome.description: attainment of <50% residual stenosis of the target lesion using post-PCI

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Procedural success at 24 hours
secondary_outcome.description: lesion success without the occurrence of major adverse cardiac event (MACE) during the hospital stay
